channel.title: Hosting
channel.description:
Hi people, I have a question.
Say I want a stable 24/7 Java server similar to RSPS servers, what kind of package should I buy? VPS? Dedicated? Any other options?
What is recommended and what is the minimum. Also, in case of a VPS, what would the specs have to be? To get and idea of what type of server I'm talking about, just think about a RSPS server.
Thanks in advance!

item.title: Hosting
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

Haha, no no, vreggie fish didn’t turn out to be a success after all.

Anyhow, the chatting part of my (Java) server which is almost finished uses TCP. It’s supposed to handle a lot of connections simultaneously, but it’s just handling basic chatting, receiving data and forwarding, nothing too special.

As for the webcam part of the server, I haven’t really started working on that yet, but I do have an idea of what I’ll be using to make that work.
I’ll most likely end up using red5 media server and on the website it says it uses the RTMP protocol (real time messaging protocol).

wikipedia quote:
“a proprietary protocol developed by Macromedia for streaming audio, video and data over the Internet, between a Flash player and a server”

I hope that’s enough information.

Extra: I can’t tell too many details about this project (it’s classified :p) but just imagine what type of server would be needed to host something like omegle or chatroullete.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:4, topic:439723”]client connected at one time? protocol type? (what sort of data transfers)

edit:

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=542416.msg3974576#msg3974576 date=1334508226]

How many players would you be averaging?
[/quote]Imagine a chat server with webcam for:

1000 people
5000 people
10000 people

you’re going to need a pretty hefty server, especially in the bandwidth department. as far as specs on processor/ram, it hard to say because you haven’t provided benchmarks for the server application[/quote]
i hope its not a vreggie fish mmorpg

Read full topic
